name: Counting within 5
description: Establish stable counting order and one-to-one correspondence for quantities up to five using concrete objects.

name: Counting within 10
description: Extend counting to ten across scattered, structured, and sequential contexts with number wordâ€”numeral connections.

name: Compare Quantities by Matching
description: Use matching and counting strategies to identify more, less, or equal groups up to ten.

name: One More and One Less
description: Determine the next or previous number within ten by adding or removing a single unit.

name: Count Story Problems within 5
description: Represent join and separate situations within five using objects, drawings, and verbal equations.

name: Compose and Decompose Teen Numbers
description: Represent teen numbers as ten ones and some more ones with beads, frames, and numerals.

name: Represent Numbers to 20
description: Read, write, and model numbers to twenty across words, numerals, and manipulatives.

name: Compare Numbers to 20
description: Compare and order numbers to twenty using models, number lines, and comparison symbols.

name: Make-Ten Combinations
description: Decompose numbers within twenty to create ten and understand complements of ten.

name: Subtraction within 10
description: Solve subtraction situations within ten using manipulatives, drawings, and equations.

name: Tens and Ones Composition
description: Compose and decompose two-digit numbers using tens and ones models and equations.

name: Ten More and Ten Less
description: Find numbers that are ten more or less within 120 using models and hundred charts.

name: Expanded Form to 120
description: Express two- and three-digit numbers in expanded form and standard form with manipulatives.

name: Hundred Chart Navigation
description: Use hundred charts to locate numbers, skip count, and recognize place-value patterns.

name: Skip Count by 2s, 5s, and 10s
description: Skip count using number lines, hundred charts, and arrays to prepare for multiplication.

name: Read and Write 3-Digit Numbers
description: Interpret and record numbers to 1000 in standard, word, and expanded forms.

name: Compare and Order Numbers to 1000
description: Compare multi-digit numbers using place-value reasoning, symbols, and word descriptions.

name: Rounding to the Nearest 10 and 100
description: Round numbers using number lines, base-ten models, and place-value understanding.

name: Compose and Decompose Hundreds
description: Regroup hundreds, tens, and ones using concrete hierarchical materials.

name: Place Value Word Problems
description: Apply place-value reasoning to multi-step contextual problems within 1000.

name: Tenths and Hundredths Models
description: Use decimal materials and area models to represent tenths and hundredths.

name: Read and Write Decimals
description: Express decimals through hundredths in word, standard, and expanded forms.

name: Compare and Order Decimals
description: Compare decimals using place-value charts, number lines, and benchmarks.

name: Relate Fractions and Decimals
description: Connect fraction and decimal representations through equivalence and conversion tasks.

name: Metric Measurement Scaling
description: Apply decimal understanding to metric units, conversions, and scaling problems.

name: Doubles and Near Doubles
description: Use doubles facts and adjustments to solve addition within twenty.

name: Make-Ten Bridge
description: Apply make-ten reasoning to addition and subtraction with teen numbers.

name: Fact Families within 20
description: Relate addition and subtraction facts using part-part-whole and inverse reasoning.

name: Dynamic Addition within 100
description: Perform two-digit addition with regrouping using place-value models, number lines, and algorithms.

name: Equal Groups and Arrays
description: Build foundational multiplication concepts through repeated addition, equal groups, and array structures.

name: Static Multiplication
description: Multiply without regrouping using golden beads, stamp game, and array diagrams.

name: Division as Sharing
description: Model division as equal sharing and relate it to multiplication facts.

name: Skip Counting for Multiplication Facts
description: Reinforce multiplication facts through rhythmic skip counting and bead chains.

name: Dynamic Multiplication
description: Multiply multi-digit numbers with regrouping using dot game, bead frames, and checkerboard.

name: Long Division
description: Divide dividends up to four digits using racks & tubes, bead frames, and standard algorithm representations.

name: Distributive and Associative Strategies
description: Apply properties of operations to simplify multiplication and division problems.

name: Multi-Step Word Problems
description: Solve multi-step problems involving multiplication and division with reasoning about remainders.

name: Factors and Multiples
description: Analyze factor pairs and multiples to support number theory and algebraic reasoning.

name: Patterns and Rules
description: Describe and generalize patterns using tables, expressions, and verbal rules.

name: Numerical Expressions
description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions with parentheses and multi-step operations.

name: Intro Equations and Inequalities
description: Represent relationships with simple equations and inequalities using variables.

name: Partition Shapes into Equal Parts
description: Partition shapes into halves, thirds, and fourths and describe each part as a fraction.

name: Unit Fractions on Number Lines
description: Locate and label unit fractions on number lines and strips.

name: Fractions of Sets
description: Determine fractional parts of sets and connect to repeated subtraction and division.

name: Compare Unit Fractions
description: Compare unit fractions using size of denominators and visual models.

name: Generate Equivalent Fractions
description: Use models and numerical reasoning to create equivalent fractions.

name: Compare Unlike Fractions
description: Compare fractions with different denominators using common denominators or numerators.

name: Benchmark Fractions
description: Use benchmarks such as 1/2 and 1 to estimate and compare fractions.

name: Mixed Numbers on Number Lines
description: Represent mixed numbers and improper fractions on number lines.

name: Add and Subtract Fractions with Like Denominators
description: Add and subtract fractions and mixed numbers with like denominators using models and equations.

name: Multiply Fractions by Whole Numbers
description: Interpret fraction multiplication as repeated addition and scaling.

name: Fraction-Decimal Conversion
description: Convert between fractions and decimals using division and place value.

name: Add and Subtract Decimals
description: Perform decimal addition and subtraction to hundredths with alignment and reasoning.

name: Compare Length, Weight, and Capacity
description: Directly compare attributes using informal language and non-standard units.

name: Choose Measurement Tools
description: Select appropriate tools and units for measuring objects and quantities.

name: Order Objects by Attribute
description: Order objects by length, weight, or capacity using comparison results.

name: Tell Time to Hour, Half-Hour, and Quarter-Hour
description: Read analog and digital clocks to the hour, half-hour, and quarter-hour.

name: Count Coins: Pennies to Quarters
description: Identify and count collections of coins up to one dollar using skip counting.

name: Make Given Amounts
description: Use coins to create specified values and exchange sets for equivalent amounts.

name: Time and Money Word Problems
description: Solve contextual problems involving elapsed time and money totals or differences.

name: Tally Charts and Tables
description: Collect data and represent it using tally charts and simple tables.

name: Picture Graphs
description: Create and interpret picture graphs representing data with single-value symbols.

name: Scaled Bar Graphs
description: Represent data using scaled bar graphs and solve one- and two-step problems.

name: Line Plots with Whole Numbers
description: Create and analyze line plots using whole-number measurements.

name: Interpret Data Word Problems
description: Solve contextual problems using information from tables and graphs.

name: Area and Perimeter of Rectangles
description: Find area and perimeter using tiling, arrays, and formulas for rectangles.

name: Volume of Rectangular Prisms
description: Calculate volume using unit cubes and formula reasoning for rectangular prisms.

name: Line Plots with Fractions
description: Create and interpret line plots featuring fractional measurements.

name: Coordinate Plane Graphing
description: Graph and interpret points in the first quadrant to model measurement contexts.

name: Data Variability and Measures
description: Describe distributions using mean, median, mode, range, and variability measures.

name: Identify 2D and 3D Shapes
description: Name and recognize common two- and three-dimensional shapes in various orientations.

name: Describe Positions
description: Use positional words to describe locations of objects relative to others.

name: Compose and Decompose Shapes
description: Combine and break apart shapes to form new figures and understand part-whole relationships.

name: Classify Shapes by Attributes
description: Group shapes based on attributes such as number of sides, angles, or faces.

name: Partition Shapes into Equal Parts (Geometry)
description: Partition shapes into equal shares and describe the parts using fractional language.

name: Lines and Angles
description: Identify and classify lines (parallel, perpendicular) and angles (acute, right, obtuse).

name: Triangles and Quadrilaterals
description: Classify triangles and quadrilaterals by sides and angles using attribute reasoning.

name: Symmetry and Reflection
description: Identify lines of symmetry and analyze reflections of shapes.

name: Area of Rectangles and Triangles
description: Calculate area using arrays, base-height formulas, and decomposition strategies.

name: Surface Area with Nets
description: Represent three-dimensional figures with nets to determine surface area.

name: Volume Concepts
description: Understand volume as space filled by unit cubes and relate to multiplication and addition.

name: Coordinate Plane Polygons
description: Plot vertices and analyze polygons on the coordinate plane, connecting to area and perimeter.

name: Graph Points in the Coordinate Plane
description: Graph ordered pairs and interpret coordinate relationships in context.

name: Classify 2D Figures in Hierarchies
description: Use hierarchies to classify polygons based on properties of sides and angles.

name: Analyze Transformations
description: Investigate translations, rotations, and reflections on grids.

name: Repeating and Growing Patterns
description: Identify, extend, and create repeating and growing patterns with concrete materials.

name: Unknown Addend Problems
description: Solve for unknown addends using part-part-whole and balance contexts.

name: Balance Contexts
description: Represent equality as balance using manipulatives and simple equations.

name: Multi-Step Problem Solving
description: Solve multi-step operational problems with reasoning and representation.

name: Input-Output Tables
description: Analyze and generalize rules generating values in tables.

name: Pattern Rules and Arithmetic Structure
description: Describe arithmetic patterns using properties and structure.

name: Evaluate Numerical Expressions
description: Evaluate expressions with parentheses, brackets, and braces following order of operations.

name: Equations with Variables
description: Write and solve simple equations using variables to represent unknowns.

name: Coordinate Relationships
description: Model relationships between two variables on the coordinate plane.

name: Intro Inequalities
description: Represent and solve simple inequalities, interpreting solution sets on number lines.

name: Compose and Decompose Thousands
description: Use thousand cubes, hundred squares, ten bars, and unit beads to build and break apart four-digit numbers.

name: Read and Write 4-Digit Numbers
description: Record four-digit numbers in standard and expanded forms using place-value cards and numerals.

name: Thousand Chart Navigation
description: Locate and sequence numbers on a thousand chart to visualize base-ten structure and place-value patterns.

name: Estimate on Number Lines
description: Place four-digit numbers on open and labeled number lines, estimating midpoints and benchmarks.

name: Locate Numbers on Number Lines
description: Place whole numbers within 1,000 on number lines with varying scales and intervals.

name: Estimate Sums and Differences
description: Use friendly numbers and number lines to estimate results of addition and subtraction problems.

name: Rounding on Number Lines
description: Round numbers to the nearest ten or hundred by identifying benchmark points on number lines.

name: Skip Count on Number Lines
description: Skip count by 2s, 5s, 10s, and 100s on open number lines to reinforce multiplication patterns.

name: Counting-On Addition
description: Use counting-on strategies with objects, number lines, and mental models to add within 20.

name: Take-Away Models
description: Model subtraction with objects and drawings, showing removal of quantities within 20.

name: Count Back and Count Up
description: Use counting-back and counting-up strategies to solve subtraction within 20.

name: Subtraction Fact Families
description: Relate subtraction to addition using fact families and part-part-whole diagrams.

name: Dynamic Subtraction within 100
description: Perform two-digit subtraction with regrouping using concrete models, number lines, and algorithms.

name: Addition Fact Drills
description: Practice addition facts within 10 and 20 using timed drills and strategy prompts.

name: Subtraction Fact Drills
description: Build subtraction fluency within 20 through structured drills and inverse relationships.

name: Make-Ten Fluency
description: Reinforce make-ten combinations and decompositions to accelerate mental calculation.

name: Facts within 20 Applications
description: Apply fluent addition and subtraction facts within 20 to stories and mixed practice.

name: Multiplication Fact Strategies
description: Use patterns, doubles, and area models to internalize multiplication facts up to 10Ã—10.

name: Division Fact Strategies
description: Connect division facts to known multiplication facts and quotient patterns.

name: Multiplication & Division Fact Families
description: Organize related multiplication and division facts to reinforce inverse relationships.

name: Mixed Fact Drills
description: Blend multiplication and division facts in timed practice to build automaticity.

name: Division as Grouping
description: Interpret division as forming equal groups and determine how many groups can be made.

name: Relate Division and Multiplication
description: Use arrays and fact families to connect division problems to multiplication facts.

name: Division Word Problems
description: Solve division story problems involving sharing and grouping with concrete and visual models.

name: Additive Word Problems
description: Solve join, separate, and compare problems using addition and subtraction strategies.

name: Comparison Word Problems
description: Interpret and solve compare problems with unknown differences using equations and diagrams.

name: Equal Groups Word Problems
description: Model equal groups situations that require multiplication or division solutions.

name: Two-Step Word Problems
description: Solve two-step problems mixing operations and explain the reasoning behind each step.
